content: The Pushkar Camel Fair is an annual event that usually takes place in the Hindu month of Kartik (October/November) on the full moon day. It typically lasts for a week, with the exact dates varying from year to year based on the Hindu calendar. The Pushkar Camel Fair is one of the most popular festivals in Rajasthan, and it's a great opportunity to experience the cultural heritage of the region. In addition to camel races and cultural events, visitors can also immerse themselves in local cuisine, music, and dance. It's an unforgettable experience that offers a unique window into the distinctive culture of Rajasthan. If you plan to attend the Pushkar Camel Fair, it's a good idea to plan in advance and make your travel arrangements early, as the festival draws large crowds from around the world.
